claim: Reported results of injections (not vaccines!) In the USA
label: misleading

claim: Roberto Klaus, a virologist at Albert Einstein Hospital, said Coronavac is not effective and mRNA vaccines can alter your DNA.
label: FALSE

claim: A video purported to be several patients lying outside a hospital’s emergency room. It claimed that people were receiving treatments on the driveway, indicating the hospital’s capacity is stretched to the limit.
label: Explanatory

claim: An ex-Sri Lankan MP in hospital with Covid-19.
label: Misleading

claim: A rehabilitation clinic in Taichung has been levied as a mobile hospital.
label: FALSE

claim: Posts purported to be words from Dr. Yuarn-Jang Lee of Taipei Medical University Hospital, explaining the backlog of COVID-19 cases. There were two other very similar versions with differences of doctors’ names.
label: FALSE

claim: Wonderful news about the Sinovac vaccine that we expect in 500,000 doses
label: FALSE

claim: A video showing how a hospital employee beats a patient is proof of a fake pandemic.
label: Misleading

claim: The head of infectious diseases at a Parisian hospital says he will not be vaccinated against covid-19 due to the many adverse effects.
label: FALSE

claim: The British government recognizes in a document that the “resurgence of both hospitalizations and deaths” is “dominated” by people vaccinated against COVID-19
label: FALSE

claim: A food supplement is a Covid-19 treatment; the remedy cured patients at a local hospital.
label: FALSE

claim: The SPI-M-O prognosis shows that the third wave of COVID-19 will result in hospitalization and death of 60-70% of people who receive both doses of the vaccine.
label: MISLEADING

claim: A flood in Manaus destroyed a makeshift hospital that was used to treat COVID-19 patients.
label: FALSE

claim: A video showing health workers singing in an empty hospital ward portrays the “truth” of the coronavirus pandemic in Brazil.
label: Misleading

claim: The cause of the oxygen crisis in India is gas line leaks in hospitals, not a spike in Covid-19 cases.
label: Misleading
